cloud_exadata_infrastructure_id.description: The unique identifier of the Exadata infrastructure for this VM cluster. Changing this will create a new resource.

cluster_name.description: The name of the Grid Infrastructure (GI) cluster. Changing this will create a new resource.

compute_model.description: The compute model used when the instance is created or cloned — either ECPU or OCPU. ECPU is a virtualized compute unit; OCPU is a physical processor core with hyper-threading.

cpu_core_count.description: The number of CPU cores to enable on the VM cluster. Changing this will create a new resource.

created_at.description: The timestamp when the VM cluster was created.

data_storage_size_in_tbs.description: The size of the data disk group, in terabytes (TBs), to allocate for the VM cluster. Changing this will create a new resource.

db_node_storage_size_in_gbs.description: The amount of local node storage, in gigabytes (GBs), to allocate for the VM cluster. Changing this will create a new resource.

db_servers.description: The list of database servers for the VM cluster. Changing this will create a new resource.

disk_redundancy.description: The type of redundancy for the VM cluster: NORMAL (2-way) or HIGH (3-way).

display_name.description: A user-friendly name for the VM cluster. This member is required. Changing this will create a new resource.

domain.description: The domain name associated with the VM cluster.

gi_version.description: A valid software version of Oracle Grid Infrastructure (GI). To get the list of valid values, use the ListGiVersions operation and specify the shape of the Exadata infrastructure. Example: 19.0.0.0 This member is required. Changing this will create a new resource.

gi_version_computed.description: A complete software version of Oracle Grid Infrastructure (GI).

hostname_prefix.description: The host name prefix for the VM cluster. Constraints: - Can't be "localhost" or "hostname". - Can't contain "-version". - The maximum length of the combined hostname and domain is 63 characters. - The hostname must be unique within the subnet. This member is required. Changing this will create a new resource.

hostname_prefix_computed.description: The host name for the VM cluster. Constraints: - Can't be "localhost" or "hostname". - Can't contain "-version". - The maximum length of the combined hostname and domain is 63 characters. - The hostname must be unique within the subnet. This member is required. Changing this will create a new resource.

iorm_config_cache.description: The Exadata IORM (I/O Resource Manager) configuration cache details for the VM cluster.

is_local_backup_enabled.description: Specifies whether to enable database backups to local Exadata storage for the VM cluster. Changing this will create a new resource.

is_sparse_diskgroup_enabled.description: Specifies whether to create a sparse disk group for the VM cluster. Changing this will create a new resource.

last_update_history_entry_id.description: The OCID of the most recent maintenance update history entry.

license_model.description: The Oracle license model to apply to the VM cluster. Default: LICENSE_INCLUDED. Changing this will create a new resource.

listener_port.description: The listener port number configured on the VM cluster.

memory_size_in_gbs.description: The amount of memory, in gigabytes (GBs), to allocate for the VM cluster. Changing this will create a new resource.

node_count.description: The total number of nodes in the VM cluster.

oci_resource_anchor_name.description: The name of the OCI resource anchor associated with the VM cluster.

oci_url.description: The HTTPS link to the VM cluster resource in OCI.

ocid.description: The OCID (Oracle Cloud Identifier) of the VM cluster.

odb_network_id.description: The unique identifier of the ODB network for the VM cluster. This member is required. Changing this will create a new resource.

percent_progress.description: The percentage of progress made on the current operation for the VM cluster.

region.description: Region where this resource will be [managed](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#regional-endpoints). Defaults to the Region set in the [provider configuration](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs#aws-configuration-reference).

scan_dns_name.description: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) for the SCAN IP addresses associated with the VM cluster.

scan_dns_record_id.description: The OCID of the DNS record for the SCAN IPs linked to the VM cluster.

scan_ip_ids.description: The list of OCIDs for SCAN IP addresses associated with the VM cluster.

scan_listener_port_tcp.description: The port number for TCP connections to the single client access name (SCAN) listener. Valid values: 1024–8999 with the following exceptions: 2484 , 6100 , 6200 , 7060, 7070 , 7085 , and 7879Default: 1521. Changing this will create a new resource.

shape.description: The hardware model name of the Exadata infrastructure running the VM cluster.

ssh_public_keys.description: The public key portion of one or more key pairs used for SSH access to the VM cluster. This member is required. Changing this will create a new resource.

status.description: The current lifecycle status of the VM cluster.

status_reason.description: Additional information regarding the current status of the VM cluster.

storage_size_in_gbs.description: The local node storage allocated to the VM cluster, in gigabytes (GB).

system_version.description: The operating system version of the image chosen for the VM cluster.

timezone.description: The configured time zone of the VM cluster. Changing this will create a new resource.

vip_ids.description: The virtual IP (VIP) addresses assigned to the VM cluster. CRS assigns one VIP per node for failover support.

block.description: The set of preferences for the various diagnostic collection options for the VM cluster. Changing this will create a new resource.

create.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

delete.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Setting a timeout for a Delete operation is only applicable if changes are saved into state before the destroy operation occurs.

update.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).
